channel.title: CVE Feed for Atlassian -- Application Links
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Atlassian -- Application Links

item.title: CVE-2017-18111|2024-09-16T17:32:37.560Z -- atlassian -- application%20links
item.description: The OAuthHelper in Atlassian Application Links before version 5.0.10, from version 5.1.0 before version 5.1.3, and from version 5.2.0 before version 5.2.6 used an XML document builder that was vulnerable to XXE when consuming a client OAuth request. This allowed malicious oauth application linked applications to probe internal network resources by requesting internal locations, read the contents of files and also cause an out of memory exception affecting availability via an XML External Entity vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2019-20105|2024-09-16T19:25:54.920Z -- atlassian -- application%20links
item.description: The EditApplinkServlet resource in the Atlassian Application Links plugin before version 5.4.20, from version 6.0.0 before version 6.0.12, from version 6.1.0 before version 6.1.2, from version 7.0.0 before version 7.0.1, and from version 7.1.0 before version 7.1.3 allows remote attackers who have obtained access to administrator's session to access the EditApplinkServlet resource without needing to re-authenticate to pass "WebSudo" in products that support "WebSudo" through an improper access control vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2019-15011|2024-09-16T19:50:47.187Z -- atlassian -- application%20links
item.description: The ListEntityLinksServlet resource in Application Links before version 5.0.12, from version 5.1.0 before version 5.2.11, from version 5.3.0 before version 5.3.7, from version 5.4.0 before 5.4.13, and from version 6.0.0 before 6.0.5 disclosed application link information to non-admin users via a missing permissions check.
